reviews.review: This is a really fun game.  I was alway intimidated by it until I watched some videos on it.  Some is a lot.  There is really nothing like it out there.   Hide and Go Seek for adults?  Good times.

425 hours played in this game, and I enjoyed a lot of the time I spent playing this game, but the devs and their balance changes, bans, and overall attitude makes it very hard for me to be able to recommend it to anyone. Fix the game, BHVR.

Juego de terror, que te transmite el miedo cuando juegas en las primeras horas despues se convierte en un juego de estrategia, aunque es pay to play para las nuevas cosas si no te importa eso, te lo recomiendo

No soy ninguna persona a tomar en cuenta en este an√°lisis por una simple raz√≥n. No puedo ser objetivo con este juego por el mero hecho de que no me gusta, lo he intentado, me he esforzado, pero no hay manera, me parece repetitivo y bastante absurdo. Aun as√≠, quiero remarcar que no por eso sea malo, pero simplemente a los jugadores acostumbrados a jugar de otra forma, y a otro tipo de juegos les va a parecer m√°s o menos lo mismo que a mi. En fin, no voy a intentar seguir dando rodeos y narrar√© las partes positivas que le veo, y las negativas que le encuentro. Considerad esto mi propia experiencia, y mi completa e independiente opini√≥n, que, no deb√©is tomar en cuenta.

A favor de jugar el juego:

Muy diferente - Es un enfoque totalmente distinto, probablemente √∫nico y bastante innovador, creo que es el primer juego en el que literalmente eres in√∫til contra el asesino, cuando juegues como el superviviente, o pr√°cticamente un dios cuando juegas como un asesino. (La gente troll se lo pasar√° pipa.)

Sistema de perks - Tiene un sistema curioso de "mejoras" ya que es aleatorio, puedes tener la suerte de conseguir una "perk" o no conseguirla hasta subir unas 100 veces de nivel y pasar por 30 prestigios. (Evidentemente exagero). Es bueno en el hecho de que cada persona est√° obligada a basarse en lo que tiene, y no en lo que quiere como pasa con los juegos con un sistema de econom√≠a, donde simplemente compran lo que quieren.

P2W no se nota - No tiene ninguna forma de abusar del P2W. Puedes comprar cosas, s√≠. Algunas de ellas est√°n rotas, como los asesinos, pero en general es un sistema bastante balanceado por lo que, sigue siendo posible ganar contra esos que prefieren invertir a√∫n m√°s dinero en el juego.

Cambia con cada partida - Resulta en una experiencia diferente cada vez, juegas contra personas diferentes cada vez, y eso le a√±ade m√°s tiempo de juego, ya que literalmente lo convierte en infinito, es pr√°cticamente imposible jugar dos partidas iguales, a menos que vayas en una premade con tus amigos (Incluyendo al asesino mismo tambi√©n.)

Variedad - Cierta variedad en los mapas, nunca sabes donde est√°n las cosas, aunque s√≠ que puedes aprender el mapa, no significa que no tengas que buscar donde se encuentran los motores que tienes que reparar, la trampilla por la que puedes huir, o la puerta por la que puedes salir.

Objetos - Objetos que dan ventajas, que, no tienen por qu√© ser P2W. A medida que subes de nivel, tambi√©n desbloqueas objetos a parte de los m√∫ltiples cofres que aparecen en cada mapa, que permiten encontrar objetos que beneficien en cierta forma a los supervivientes. Se agradece un sistema de "contrarrestar" la forma en la que el asesino juega.

Ausencia de chat - Aunque parezca un defecto, en realidad le a√±ade dos cosas positivas, la primera de ellas siendo la inmersi√≥n que te da, en cuanto est√°s solo y lo √∫nico que puedes hacer es un gesto de se√±alar con el dedo, y otro gesto de "Ven aqu√≠" que le dan un toque m√°s interesante y profundo al juego y, por otra parte, esquivas todo el rage de cada novato que toca en el equipo, que probablemente durante toda la partida estar√≠a insultando y llorando sobre el mal team que le ha tocado. (No os preocup√©is, el lobby tiene chat.)

A favor de no jugar el juego:

El matchmaking - ¬øA qui√©n se le ocurre que es una buena idea mezclar a jugadores de rangos altos, bajos y medios en una misma partida? ¬øQui√©n ha pensado que eso saldr√° bien? En este punto no hay mucho m√°s que decir, el juego le importa lo mismo poner a una persona con el rango 1 (M√°ximo rango) con una de rango 20 (M√≠nimo rango) contra un asesino de rango 10. Es as√≠, literalmente tu rango no se toma en cuenta para nada.

El rango ‚Äì Es un sistema que, a mi parecer, es o bien demasiado rebuscado, o bien demasiado mal hecho. Si en una partida te matan, a pesar de haber hecho una ‚Äúbuena‚Äù partida, con una cierta cantidad de puntos, no llegas a 2 esquirlas, pierdes tu esquirla, que, para mantener tu rango necesitas 1, y para subir necesitas 3, acabas bajando de rango, y por dar un ejemplo, si tu equipo es totalmente in√∫til, y les matan a los primeros segundos, o simplemente el asesino tiene muchas m√°s horas de juego que t√∫, no tienes ni la menor posibilidad de conservar ese rango, o al menos, es lo que he visto de mi propia experiencia. Es cierto que el rango no se toma en cuenta pr√°cticamente para nada, pero siempre alegra ver lo bueno que eres, teniendo un buen rango.

Los asesinos como hosts ‚Äì Perfecta estrategia para ahorrar dinero a la compa√±√≠a, y demostrar lo poco que te importan tus jugadores. En vez de comprar servidores dedicados, con buena conexi√≥n en todos los puntos del mundo donde el tr√°fico ser√≠a bastante elevado y el coste a su vez tambi√©n, consiguen encontrar la forma barata de hacer las cosas (El t√≠pico chapuzas que dice que sabe mucho y en realidad hace todo lo posible para timarte.), que el asesino sea el host, y es cuando entras a partidas con 400 de ping, que por muy buen internet que tengas, no depende de ti. Es muy gracioso ver que te vas de un lobby, para luego unirte a otro donde pasas a 600 de ping, y si no eres t√∫, no pasa nada, tienes a 3 jugadores m√°s que tienen buenas cartas para jugar a peor ping.

Comunidad - ¬øComunidad, que es eso? ¬øTenemos de eso en Dead By Daylight? ¬øPara qu√© vamos a escuchar los consejos y solicitudes de la gente? Literalmente se pasan por el forro todo lo que les piden los usuarios y hacen todo lo posible que los asesinos de pago sean los mejores en comparaci√≥n con el resto. ¬øQu√© ser√° lo siguiente? ¬øLootboxes? ¬øO llaves para abrir los cofres en el mapa? Nadie lo sabr√°, porque total, nadie pide la opini√≥n en Dead By Daylight, tan solo se deja a los jugadores ante el hecho y poco m√°s. Supongo que gracias por eso.

Valoraci√≥n de tus actos en la partida ‚Äì El sistema de puntos en este juego est√° bastante bien con un gran ‚Äúpero‚Äù sobrevivir es lo m√°s importante, si escapas, aseguras que no vas a perder. ¬øQu√© significa eso? Que le den al equipo, yo me escondo al principio de la partida en un armario, espero a que maten a todos, y busco la trampilla. No voy a perder ninguna esquirla y saldr√© como el pro porque por eso me dar√°n 1000 puntos, que autom√°ticamente te aseguran casi todos los puntos que necesitas para no perder ninguna esquirla. En cambio, si salvas a tus compa√±eros 20 veces, reparas los motores, toreas al asesino, pero al final mueres, es muy probable que al final pierdas igual y bajes de rango. Que bien. Que justo.

Tolerancia con el campeo - ¬øHay alg√∫n juego en este mundo que tolere a jugadores que campean? Si, lo hay, es Dead By Daylight, seg√∫n ellos mismos campear es algo normal. Vaya, durante todo el tiempo que he estado jugando simplemente estaba enga√±ado, en realidad resulta que campear es lo normal y lo bueno, todos tendr√≠an que hacerlo, y lo peor de todo es que no se toma ni una sola medida para impedirlo. Que divertido es cuando ves a un asesino que coge a tu compa√±ero y se planta delante de su cara, ri√©ndose y haciendo cosas rasas como dar golpes, y cosas as√≠, esperando a que tu compa√±ero simplemente muera. En vez de poner un sistema de motivaci√≥n para hacer que los asesinos se muevan, dejen que los jugadores se salven y tal, aqu√≠ es mejor que simplemente campeen. Me pregunto si el pr√≥ximo nombre de dead by daylight 2 va a ser Camping Simulator.

Bugs ‚Äì ‚ÄúWe did a pretty good job so far‚Äù que ya es un meme entre los jugadores de dead by daylight, y todos esos videos de risa en YouTube con la gente haciendo compilaciones de errores absurdos que les ocurren en partidas normales, donde salen volando y cosas as√≠, lo peor de todo es que he jugado unas 50 partidas en total (No las he contado) pero en 4 de ellas, me he quedado atascado en una pared del granero, en un pal√©, y tambi√©n he salido volando con el asesino que me recog√≠a, adem√°s de caerme a trav√©s del mapa cuando me han sacado del gancho.

En conclusi√≥n ‚Äì Es un juego con un potencial infinito y mala gesti√≥n.

Honestly, I would only recommend buying this game if you have a select group of friends to enjoy it with. The online community for this game is extremely toxic, but private murder games with your friends is where this game shines.

Toxic wasteland with more bugs than fixes.
Only enjoyable if you play with friends.
As a former rank 1 (sure, this says nothing), gameplay only gets more toxic the higher you climb until you reach the point there's no benefit in playing this game at all.

Highly recommend this game, it kicks ass in so many ways no other assymetrical pvp game does. Many iconic killers and more to come.

Achja.... Dead by Daylight. Wo fange ich am besten an? Kleine Randinfo: Ich gehe auf die meisten Bans von YouTubern wie N0ob3 in dieser Review nicht ein. Es wird schon einen Grund haben warum sie gebannt wurden und ich bin auch der Meinung, dass der Support nicht YouTuber bevorzugen sollte. Na dann:

Was ist Dead By Daylight?:
In Dead By Daylight vom Studio Behaviour Digital Inc. geht es darum als Survivor im Team zu √úberleben, oder als Killer Survivor an Haken zu h√§ngen um sie dem sogennanten "Entitus" zu Opfern. Beiden Parteien stehen in Dead By Daylight besondere F√§higkeiten sowie ein belohnendes Level Up System zur Verf√ºgung. √úberlebende zum Beispiel k√∂nnen Palletten umwerfen und damit den Killer f√ºr eine kurze Zeit au√üer gefecht setzen. Der Killer wiederum ist schneller und kann die Palletten zerst√∂ren und hat je nach Killer noch andere F√§higkeiten wie Fallen platzieren (The Trapper) oder √Ñxte auf seine gegner zu werfen (The Huntress). Die meisten Killer k√∂nnen schon durch weite ferne von √úberlebenden geh√∂rt werden. Wenn ein Killer einen Survivor endeckt hat beginnt die Jagd. Die verl√§uft je nach Rang des Killers und der Survivor unterschiedlich ab. Killer sind f√ºr Neulinge zu stark, w√§hrend die meisten keine Chance haben einen 700h Survivor einzuholen. Desto h√∂her man im Level steigt, destp h√§rter wird es f√ºr die Killer.
In Dead by Daylight ist man √∂fters auch auf das Team angewiesen um einen zum Beispiel vor dem grausamen Entitus zu sch√ºtzen. Dies funktioniert meist ziemlich gut, da √úberlebende Punkte f√ºr jede Rettung erhalten, die zum √úberleben ben√∂tigt wird. Ein gro√ües Problem stellen aber Camper und sogenannte "Tunnler" da, die einen am Haken bewachen bis man stirbt und damit eine Rettung unm√∂glich machen, oder sich das ganze Spiel nur auf einen fokusieren bis er tot ist. Beides kommt leider auf jedem Rang h√§ufig vor. Trotzdem bleibt Dead by Daylight f√ºr 20 Euro (ohne DLC) eine durchaus motivierende Erfahrung.

As someone who has been watching people play this game since 2016, and playing since 2017 myself, I partially recommend this game. It has a toxic but hilarious community. This game involves lots of mind games, strategy, and teamwork. The cons of  dbd are solo queue, RNG, trash teammates, and unfair hits. However my favorite part of playing this game is getting chased, doing special "techs" and memeing with the killer/other teammates. 

Dead by daylight will always be one of my favorite games despite its toxicity and bugs, but its not for everyone. Beware of camping and tunneling killers / tbagging flashlight clicking survivors. <3

Overall I like this game.  It has come a long way since it launched bt it still needs some work in the case of balance and bugs.  

Don't bother with the forums if you're new.  It's a toilet.  

Also it would be best to ignore the recent bad reviews.  Some toxic youtubers got banned recently and they fanbois are brigading.

Dead by Daylight is a 1 v 4 multiplayer only, "survival horror" game. Don't let the survival horror aspect fool you. After you play for a bit as both killer and survivor, the horror aspect disappears pretty quickly.

This game has an arcade feel to it as games can typically end in about 10-15 minutes or so on average, which is what drew me to the gameplay. Survivors need to activate 5 generators which give access to 2 locked exit gates. Once they open the gates, they can escape. Killers need to sacrifice as many survivors as possible and prevent their escape. There are quite a few killers/survivors to choose from, but a decent chunk are held behind paywalls or the in-game currency system, which you can use to purchase characters that are not licensed. Killers like Michael Myers or Leatherface will cost money regardless. Survivors are simply different skins and are mostly picked up for their specific perks. Killers will also have specific perks as well, but they at least offer a unique experience in game for better or for worse.

I will start out by saying this.

When you first start out as a survivor, you will die. A lot. The key aspect to this game is understanding map design, chase mechanics, and killer functions. Once you get past that and start throwing perks into the mix, survivor becomes one of the easiest multiplayer experiences that I have personally ever played.

When you first start out as killer, you will win for a bit and then the game will become noticeably more difficult. And over time as you ascend the ranks, the difficulty will spike to frustrating levels due to the mechanics currently in-game. You can still win, but for a while, even completely wiping a team as killer felt unsatisfying for me.

I highly recommend playing both sides to not only learn faster, but also to play all of the way to Rank 1 to get a true understanding on this game's current balance situation. Rank 1 gameplay is a drastically different experience for both sides.

So why am I saying all of this? In my opinion, this game very heavily favors the survivor side of the game at the moment. As the killer, you are extremely dependent on the survivors making mistakes. If you fail to capitalize on their mistakes or they simply don't mess up, there is a high chance of taking a loss, since time is the killer's most important weapon in this game. Combine this with a number of second chance perks available to survivors and you're in for a rough ride when you get to higher ranks. 

This isn't to say that the survivor experience is always a walk in the park. Playing solo survivor can be a consistent exercise in frustration if your teammates do not have your well-being in mind. Killers may also "slug" you, which is simply leaving you on the ground when you're knocked down; "camp" you on a hook, which is remaining near your hooked body to defend against your teammates; and "tunnel" you, which is when a killer goes after an injured player immediately after he/she has been unhooked. I don't blame killers for this kind of gameplay since time isn't necessarily on their side, but it can be an unfun experience as a survivor if you're at the mercy of your poor teammates. 

At this point, I think the best way to play this game is with friends on survivor. For killer, I'd recommend just taking the mentality that it won't be balanced for high level competitive play. I'm not saying that you'll constantly lose at high ranks, but you will absolutely have games where you'll get stomped because survivors simply played optimally. You are not the power role in current state (although you can soften the blow with a couple of killers and particular loadouts). Also, as killer, unless you're hardened to internet tough guys/gals, you may want to turn off in-game chat. This game's community is one of the worst I've ever seen.

Amazingly, after the stupid amount of text I just barfed onto this screen, I'd still recommend the game as long as you have friends to play with and maybe someone who can quickly show you the ropes. There's nothing else like it right now, so it has that edge for the time being.

I am going to recommend this game but please be warned that if you dedicate a significant amount of time to this game you will get frustrated.

What I like: 
-This is a great game to play with your friends (Survivors up to 4 including yourself)
-There are some jumpscare moments.
-Forces you to use your brain and outsmart your opponent.
-Licensed Killers! Plenty of survivors to choose from.

What I don't like:
-Match making is horrendous. (I'll explain below)
-The game can be unbalanced allowing for a severe advantage over your opponent (killer or survivor)
-The is fun untill you pass rank 12 (for me) it just feels like a grind after that with rare matches actually being fun.

Matchmaking: 
A lot of killers will dodge lobbies if they see Survive with Friends (SWF) They will dodge the lobby for a lot of reasons. Who knows. Survivors will Disconnect mid game if they feel like they are being treated unfair and that screws your entire team. Sometimes you will be matched with higher ranked people and that makes the match a bit more challenging. 
Sometimes this game feels like lobby simulator after rank 10.

I thought the Overwatch community was toxic but this is by far the most toxic community I have ever been a part of. Post game chat is cringy as hell.

Honestly, it is a fun game and I will continue to play it because it is a unique game in that they really don't have any REAL competition. F13th isn't the same game so it's easy to ignore the player base and continue to pump out money making DLC and ignore the real issues.

You should play the game but don't expect a whole lot out of it.

ADDED TOO MUCH.  In the strive for dlc's and new perks the game isnt at all as fun as it used to be. now killers can just do whatever they want and anything you do can be countered with the 12000 perks the game has. waste of time at this point

This game goes down as the dumb devs ban the ppl that brought the most ppl to their game... Do me a favor and dont buy this so that the idiots lose their money... They dont have a single idea what they are doing... JUSTICE FOR NOOB3,OCHIDO AND OTHERS

Normally not my kind of game, but a great experience.
Would buy it again.

Wonderful game, made especially great by the fact that the developers have made a move to eliminating toxic/cheating players. There is a sudden influx of negative reviews due to a few popular streamers getting temp and perma-banned; every single ban issued was in fact deserved. The most vocal fanbase is for noob3 who has admited to cheating in the past.

PROS: 
-Exciting game, playing against real people keeps things challenging and stressful. 
-Developers are really involved in the community
-A wide choice of killers (with unique playstyles) keeps things from being too repetitive
-Options to join in solo (as killer or survivor), with a group of friends against a killer, or a full group of 5 with one of you being killers.

CONS:
-Pointless rank-system which resets monthly with no rewards in place for ranking.
-Developers are pretty heavily focused on licenesed killers, which I find a little disapointing. 
-Lack of cosmetics. Seriously BVHR I would buy a monthly cosmetics pack. 

Seriously though, I have over 200 hours on this game, and I would recommend.
Max out altruism every game if you're the true bro
ok so basically u play as black girl and you do russian kick dance but without the kick (some call this t-bagging) and if you do it enough time you win game

So, first the bad: occasional gameplay bugs and glitches (seem rather rare though); some killer/survivor perks are near-mandatory while many others are borderline worthless; matchmaking can be rather hit-and-miss depending on how many people are online; a LOT of the players (under 50%, but not by much) are toxic.

Now the good: the gameplay is REALLY fun, one of the few asymmetrical games that feels like NOT a one-sided stomp; getting to chainsaw someone is really cathartic; the killers have a variety of interesting powers to play around; the graphics are pretty good. Overall I have fun playing this, which IMO is the ultimate metric.

Very enjoyable game into which I've sunk many hours. It has its flaws, and its occasional bugs, but on the whole I'd say it's well worth the money. DLCs are usually good and reasonably priced. If you want an assymetrical PVP game and you enjoyed Evolve or the L4D series, then there's a good chance you'll enjoy this.

Game with probably the best asymetric pvp concept.
Sadly its being held back by the inexperience of the developers which leads to frequent bugs and outdated graphics.
The gameplay is fun if you can overlook those two things.

I almost wish for a sequel of this game, fresh code base, better quality control and better game art.

I have played this game for quite some time. Invested a good amount of hours, and i can say w/out a doubt, the devs are garbage. They invest more time picking up licenses for killers than fixing their game. After taking a few weeks off and trying to pick it up again, i realise how bad they mutilated this, what use to be, great game. Rank resets are an idiotic, the power balance is definitely horrid, and it definitely feels like they just want money now instead of a great game. The rank resets bring in a whole new migrane into every match, nothing worse than playing like a rank 1 and dealing w/ new rank 20s. The only way around this is Survive W/ Friends and your lucky to find a killer that doesnt dodge after seeing a few people join in all at once. I will gladly come back when they pull their hand off my wallet and put it back on the keyboard to fix their game that most of us have spent more than enough money on.

Heya! 

So at the state of now I've been playing Dead by Daylight for over 900 hours and I can say it's pretty complicated to write a review for it.

First: This is NOT a Horror-Game. I know they tagged it that way, but a single look on Youtube will show you fast enough: It has nothing in common with Horror except some blood splatter here and there.

This game is more like a COMPETITIVE game with balancing issues, bugs that are just overlooked, additional microtransactions (yes, as an addition to the 30 Euro for the game itself), huge server and matchmaking problems and a overall bad support and patching experience.

So yes, this game is full of flaws and quirks, but you know what created my almost 1k hour count on this game? Playing with friends. Getting to know future friends through solo queue. Strategies, fun builds, constantly learning new mechanics and adapting to new patches. But this is all due to me already being used to the game from almost the start. Beginners could have a tough time with it.

And please don't play it on the Switch, will ya?
